name: Create a New Project
tryIt: Try saying: 'Create a new project with Vite and React'
description: Set up a fresh project directory. This is your blank canvas — every design-to-code journey starts here.

name: Describe and Build
tryIt: Try saying: 'Build a landing page with a hero section, feature cards, and a signup form'
description: Tell Claude what you want in plain language and watch it write the code. This is the core skill — describe your vision, get working software.

name: Preview in Browser
tryIt: Try saying: 'Start the dev server so I can see my app in the browser'
description: Start a local server so you can preview your work in a browser in real-time. See changes instantly as Claude builds your UI.

name: Use Screenshots
tryIt: Try saying: 'Take a screenshot and tell me what looks off'
description: Take a screenshot of your running app and share it with Claude. The most natural way to give feedback — just show it what needs fixing.

name: Set Up GitHub
tryIt: Try saying: 'Set up a GitHub repo for this project and push the code'
description: Connect your project to GitHub for version control. This protects your work and lets you collaborate with engineers on their terms.

name: Use a Branch
tryIt: Try saying: 'Create a new branch called feature/redesign'
description: Create a separate branch to work on without affecting the main code. Essential for safe experimentation — you can always throw it away.

name: Push to Main
tryIt: Try saying: 'Merge my branch into main and push it'
description: Merge your branch back into main and push it. This is how your changes become official and available to the rest of the team.

name: Clone and Modify
tryIt: Try saying: 'Clone this repo and walk me through the codebase'
description: Clone an existing repository and make it your own. Fork a template, explore the code, and start modifying — the fastest way to learn from real projects.

name: Download BHR Frontend
tryIt: Try saying: 'Clone the BHR frontend repo and get it running locally'
description: Clone the BHR frontend repository from GitHub and set it up on your machine. Your starting point for working on the real product codebase.

name: Connect Figma MCP
tryIt: Share a Figma link and say: 'Look at this design'
description: Link Figma directly to Claude Code so it can see your actual design files — not just descriptions of them. This is the bridge between design and code.

name: Build from Figma
tryIt: Share a Figma link and say: 'Build this screen exactly as designed'
description: Give Claude a Figma link and have it generate the full UI in code. The closest thing to dragging a design straight into a codebase.

name: Iterate with Screenshots
tryIt: Take a screenshot and say: 'Compare this to the Figma — what's different?'
description: Screenshot your build, compare it to the Figma design, and tell Claude what to fix. This is the design QA loop — refine until it's pixel-perfect.

name: Build Multiple Screens
tryIt: Say: 'Now build the settings page from the same Figma file'
description: Build more than one screen from your Figma file. Scale from a single page prototype to a full multi-screen app.

name: Create a Chatbot
tryIt: Try saying: 'Build a chatbot that uses the Anthropic API with streaming responses'
description: Build a project that uses an AI API key, like a chatbot. Learn how real AI-powered features connect under the hood.

name: Use Playwright
tryIt: Try saying: 'Test my app by navigating to each page and checking for errors'
description: Use browser automation to navigate your local site and verify it works. Automated QA without manual clicking through every page.

name: Generate Mockups
tryIt: Try saying: 'Generate 3 different layout options for a dashboard as separate HTML files'
description: Ask Claude to generate multiple HTML mockup variations for a single idea. Rapidly explore different layouts, styles, and approaches before committing to one direction.

name: Deploy to URL
tryIt: Try saying: 'Deploy this project to Vercel so I can share the link'
description: Ship your project to the internet so anyone can see it. Share a real, clickable URL with stakeholders — not just a screenshot.

name: Edit CLAUDE.md
tryIt: Try saying: 'Create a CLAUDE.md that tells Claude to use Tailwind and keep code simple'
description: Customize how Claude behaves in your project by editing its instructions file. Set your preferences, conventions, and constraints.

name: Create INTENT.md
tryIt: Try saying: 'Create an INTENT.md that captures what we're building and why'
description: Create a file that preserves your project context across Claude sessions. It picks up where you left off — even after closing the terminal.

name: Create a Skill
tryIt: Try saying: 'Create a /component slash command that generates a React component from a description'
description: Build a custom slash command that packages a complex workflow into a single action. Your own personalized Claude superpower.
